physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. A had a diminished appetite and had lost 70 lb. He reported confusion and some memory problems. His mental status report described him as thin and tearful with clear speech, discouraged affect, well-organized thought processes, and no active thoughts of harming himself or others. He was alert, oriented, and judged to have above-average intelligence.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, Mr. A started chemotherapy and radiation, which alleviated his shortness of breath, and he also began taking an antidepressant. His mood and cognitive clarity improved but later worsened due to increased pain, confusion, and paranoia as he decreased his pain medication.
